title: A neural network approach to predict opioid misuse among previously hospitalized patients using electronic health records
details: L Vega, W Conneen, MA Veronin, RP Schumaker - Plos one, 2024
abstract: Can Electronic Health Records (EHR) predict opioid misuse in general patient populations? This research trained three backpropagation neural networks to explore EHR predictors using existing patient data. Model 1 used patient diagnosis …

title: Improving Extraction of Clinical Event Contextual Properties from Electronic Health Records: A Comparative Study

abstract: Electronic Health Records are large repositories of valuable clinical data, with a significant portion stored in unstructured text format. This textual data includes clinical events (eg, disorders, symptoms, findings, medications and procedures) in …

title: Leveraging an Electronic Health Record Patient Portal to Help Patients Formulate Their Health Care Goals: Mixed Methods Evaluation of Pilot Interventions
details: J Naimark, ME Tinetti, T Delbanco, Z Dong, K Harcourt… - JMIR Formative Research, 2024
abstract: Background Persons with multiple chronic conditions face complex medical regimens and clinicians may not focus on what matters most to these patients who vary widely in their health priorities. Patient Priorities Care is a facilitator-led process …

title: Influence of polygenic risk on height and BMI in adults with a 22q11. 2 microdeletion
details: S Ying, T Heung, B Morrow, B Thiruvahindrapuram… - 2024
abstract: Background Adult height and body mass index (BMI) are highly heritable traits that can be influenced by both common variants, captured collectively in a polygenic risk score (PRS), and by rare variants of large effect. In this study, we aimed to investigate …
